title: Eddie Van Halen helps bring music back to schools by donating 75 guitars from his collection
text:
Eddie Van Halen helps bring music back to schools by donating 75 guitars from his collection By: Oscar Rangel AXS Contributor Feb 23, 2017 31 minutes ago 12 12 16541761 6 y2017m02d23 115106 CNN 
Eddie Van Halen and Felice Mancini of Mr.Holland's Opus Foundation recently revealed to CNN's John Vausewith of his big donation in a recent interview . 75 of Eddie Van Halen's guitars from his personal collection were given to Mr. Holland’s Opus Foundation to distribute the axes to low-income public schools. 
The guitar icon told CNN: "My whole life has been music. I could not imagine anything else. It really hit me when I graduated high school, you sign everybody's yearbook and everybody asks you, 'So what college are you going to?' Uh... 'Hey Al, I think we better stick to what we know.'" 
Foundation president Felice Mancini stated: "It’s the gift that keeps on giving. The kids share the guitars, they learn, they graduate and then the instruments stay in the school." 
The gift ensures that children receiving the generous donation by the rock legend will be given the chance to shred while promoting the arts. 
"Music is such a necessity. It touches people's souls," Eddie Van Halen told CNN. "Music is the universal language to me. It transcends everything." 
Van Halen is currently not on tour but we'll keep you posted on when they do here on AXS.com . By: Oscar Rangel AXS Contributor Feb 23, 2017 Added 31 minutes ago Sponsor
